intro: Heracleum austriacum var. glaberrimum, commonly known as the Austrian cowparsnip, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and tall, branched stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. The smooth, hairless stems and leaves of this variety distinguish it from other members of the species.
